page.title: 08ABERGELE FIRE SERVICE
page.content:
There has been a fire service in Abergele since the 19th Century. The Station in Groes Lwyd opened in 1971. The 12 part-time firemen all have full time jobs and are called by "bleeper", by Central Control at Rhyl.
There are two large appliances. These carry six firemen and twenty hoses of various kinds plus a wide range of special equipment. The smaller landrover vehicle carries two or three firemen. The men are given 4 minutes to reach the station and 4 minutes to reach an emergency in the area of the town. For country emergencies they are allowed 20 minutes and can summon additional help from Rhyl or Colwyn Bay. On average they are called out 200 times a year. A fireman must be at least 5'6" tall and able to carry a 12 stone man 100 yds in 1 minute.
